medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with stunted growth at age 15.9 years, with thyroid function normal at birth. Growth curves declined around age 7, crossing the 2.5th percentile at age 9.5 years. The patient showed a significant decline in thyroid function by age 24, characterized by a huge goiter and severe clinical symptoms of hypothyroidism.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Normal thyroid function at birth. Patient had poor compliance to L-T4 treatment, leading to periods of severe hypothyroidism and erratic medical follow-up.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's parents were first cousins. The 4.5-year-old sister was also found to be homozygous for the mutation with normal clinical data except for elevated urinary MIT and DIT excretion. No family history of hypothyroidism or goiter is reported.
